info.author: achais
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: Apache Software License
Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries :: Python Modules
info.description:
beanstalkclient
===============

beanstalkclient is a simple beanstalkd client library for Python. beanstalkd is a fast, distributed, in-memory workqueue service.

beanstalkclient on Python 2 and Python 3 is supported.

Usage
=====

Here is a short example:

.. code:: python

    >>> import beanstalk
    >>> bsc = beanstalk.Connection(host='127.0.0.1', port=11300)
    >>> beanstalk.put('Hi!')
    1
    >>> job = beanstalk.reserve()
    >>> job.body
    Hi!
    >>> job.delete()

Here is a hashring example:

.. code:: python

    # ==================== Terminal ======================
    # beanstalkd -l 127.0.0.1 -p 11300
    # beanstalkd -l 127.0.0.1 -p 11301
    # beanstalkd -l 127.0.0.1 -p 11302
    # ========== open three beanstalkd services ==========

    import beanstalk

    servers = [
        '127.0.0.1:11300',
        '127.0.0.1:11301',
        '127.0.0.1:11302'
    ]

    weights = {
        '127.0.0.1:11300': 1,
        '127.0.0.1:11301': 2,
        '127.0.0.1:11302': 2
    }

    bsc = beanstalk.HashRingConnection(servers=servers, weights=weights)
    for i in range(100):
        tube_name = "%s" % i
        bsc.use(tube_name)
        body = 'Hi #%s! put to %s:%s' % (i, bsc.host, bsc.port)
        bsc.put(body)

    while True:
        for i in range(100):
            tube_name = "%s" % i
            bsc.watch(tube_name)
            job = bsc.reserve()
            print(job.body, "this bsc is %s:%s" % (bsc.host, bsc.port))
            job.delete()

For more information, see the `tutorial <https://achais.github.io/beanstalkclient>`_, which will explain most everything.
